page.title: 11ROYAL NATIONAL ROSE SOCIETY
page.content: The Queen Mother is the patron of the Rose Society,which was founded in 1876 on the outskirts of{CHISWELL {GREEN.}The society provides {employment}for eleven local people, five people work outside and six people work inside. There are two gardener's cottages on the premises.The Rose Society is not a commercial enterprise, the plants are not sold to the public, they are planted in trial grounds and may only be visited. New rose trees are sent from all over the world to be tested in the trial beds for scent,colour and growth in the English climate. The Rose season starts in mid June and lasts until the end of September.In that time 35,000 people visit the grounds and 2,000 varieties of roses are on exhibition.
